events.originalText: A bomb exploded in the Myyrmanni shopping center in Helsinki, Finland, resulting in 7 deaths and 159 injuries.
events.subtitle: Myyrmanni bombing
events.headline: Bomb explosion at Myyrmanni shopping center in Helsinki, Finland: 7 dead, 159 injured

events.originalText: During the confirmation hearings upon the nomination of Clarence Thomas to the Supreme Court of the United States, Anita Hill testified that he had sexually harassed her several years earlier.
events.subtitle: Clarence Thomas Supreme Court nomination
events.headline: Anita Hill testifies against Clarence Thomas during Supreme Court nomination hearings

events.originalText: Sri Lankan Civil War: The Indian Peace Keeping Force began Operation Pawan to take control of Jaffna from the Tamil Tigers and enforce their disarmament as a part of the Indo-Sri Lanka Accord.
events.subtitle: Sri Lankan Civil War
events.headline: Indian Peace Keeping Force launches Operation Pawan in Sri Lankan Civil War

events.originalText: An estimated 750,000 people attended the "Great March" in Washington, D.C., to demand greater civil rights for the LGBT community.
events.subtitle: Second National March on Washington for Lesbian and Gay Rights
events.headline: 750,000 attend 'Great March' in Washington, D.C., for LGBT rights

events.originalText: The American weekly sketch comedy–variety show Saturday Night Live was broadcast for the first time.
events.subtitle: Sketch comedy
events.headline: Saturday Night Live premieres as weekly sketch comedy show

events.originalText: Typhoon Nora, the fourth-most intense tropical cyclone on record, dissipated after killing 40 people and leaving more than a million homeless across Taiwan and the Philippines.
events.subtitle: Typhoon Nora (1973)
events.headline: Typhoon Nora dissipates after killing 40, leaving million homeless in Taiwan and Philippines

events.originalText: Apollo 7 (lift-off pictured), the first manned mission of NASA's Apollo program, and the first three-man American space mission, launched from Complex 34 in Cape Kennedy, Florida.
events.subtitle: Apollo 7
events.headline: Apollo 7 launches as first manned mission of NASA's Apollo program

events.originalText: World War II: At the Battle of Cape Esperance on the northwest coast of Guadalcanal, American ships intercepted and defeated a Japanese fleet sent to attack Henderson Field.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: American ships defeat Japanese fleet at Battle of Cape Esperance in World War II

events.originalText: Edward, Duke of Windsor, and Wallis, Duchess of Windsor, arrived at Berlin Friedrichstraße station to begin a tour of Nazi Germany, where they were greeted with Nazi salutes and dined with high-ranking members of the state apparatus.
events.subtitle: Edward VIII
events.headline: Duke and Duchess of Windsor greeted with Nazi salutes in Berlin

events.originalText: The Morant Bay rebellion, led by Paul Bogle and George William Gordon, began in Jamaica; after protestors burned down the courthouse, it was brutally suppressed by Governor Edward John Eyre.
events.subtitle: Morant Bay rebellion
events.headline: Morant Bay rebellion begins in Jamaica, brutally suppressed by Governor Eyre

events.originalText: The University of Sydney (pictured), Australia's oldest university, was inaugurated two years after being established by the University of Sydney Act.
events.subtitle: University of Sydney
events.headline: University of Sydney inaugurated as Australia's oldest university

events.originalText: Bashir Shihab II (pictured) surrendered to the Ottoman Empire and was removed as Emir of Mount Lebanon after an imperial decree by Sultan Abdülmecid I.
events.subtitle: Bashir Shihab II
events.headline: Bashir Shihab II surrenders to Ottoman Empire as Emir of Mount Lebanon

events.originalText: French Revolutionary Wars: The Royal Navy captured eleven Dutch Navy ships without any losses at the Battle of Camperdown.
events.subtitle: French Revolutionary Wars
events.headline: Royal Navy captures eleven Dutch Navy ships at Battle of Camperdown

events.originalText: American Revolutionary War: A British fleet defeated American ships at the Battle of Valcour Island on Lake Champlain, but gave American forces enough time to prepare their defenses for the Saratoga campaign.
events.subtitle: American Revolutionary War
events.headline: British fleet defeats American ships at Battle of Valcour Island

events.originalText: The peerage and clergy of the Kingdom of England published the Ordinances of 1311 to restrict King Edward II's powers.
events.subtitle: Peerage of England
events.headline: Ordinances of 1311 published to restrict King Edward II's powers

events.originalText: The Treaty of Shaoxing was ratified, ending the Jin–Song Wars, although sporadic fighting continued until 1234.
events.subtitle: Treaty of Shaoxing
events.headline: Treaty of Shaoxing ratified, ending Jin-Song Wars
